channel.title: Feature Branches :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: This section summarizes the git commands you will need when creating feature branches for your semester-long project. 1. Create and check out a local branch for the current milestone When you start a new milestone, you need to create a local branch to hold your work. For example, if you wanted to create a feature branch for Milestone 0, you would do: $ git branch ms0Next, check out your new branch.
